verses.roman:
yaśodā rohiṇī nando
gopyo gopāś ca kaurava
kṛṣṇaṁ sametya labdhehā
āsan śuṣkā nagā api

synonyms: yaśodā rohiṇī nandaḥ—Yaśodā, Rohiṇī and Nanda Mahārāja; gopyaḥ—the cowherd ladies; gopāḥ—the cowherd men; ca—and; kaurava—O Parīkṣit, descendant of Kuru; kṛṣṇam—Lord Kṛṣṇa; sametya—meeting; labdha—having regained; īhāḥ—their conscious functions; āsan—they became; śuṣkāḥ—dried up; nagāḥ—the trees; api—even.
translation: Having regained their vital functions, Yaśodā, Rohiṇī, Nanda and all the other cowherd women and men went up to Kṛṣṇa. O descendant of Kuru, even the dried-up trees came back to life.
